verses.verse: As he left the temple, one of his disciples said to him, "Master, look what stones, what buildings!"
Jesus answered and said to him, "You see all these great buildings? There will not be one stone on top of another that will not be thrown down."
As he sat on the Mount of Olives facing the Temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked him privately,
"Tell us, when will these things happen? What will the sign be when all these things will be fulfilled?"
Jesus answered them and began to say, "Beware, don't let anyone deceive you,
"for many will come in my name saying, «I AM» and will deceive many.
"When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, don't be troubled, for such it must be, but the end is not yet.
"For nation will rise up against nation and kingdom against kingdom, and there will be earthquakes in various places. There will be famines and troubles. These are the beginning of sorrows.

"But you watch out for yourselves, for they will deliver you up to councils and in synagogues. You will be beaten, and you will be brought before rulers and kings on account of me, for a testimony to them.
"The gospel must first be proclaimed to all nations.

"But when they take you away and put you in prison, don't worry about what you will say, neither go over it in your mind ahead of time will you will say, but speak whatever will be given you at that time, for it is not you who speaks but the Holy Spirit.
"Brother will betray brother to death, and father the son, and children will rise up against parents and will cause them to be killed.
"You will be hated by all, because of my name, but the one who endures to the end, that same will be saved.
"But when you see «The Abomination of Desolation» spoken by Daniel the Prophet, standing where it must not-let him who reads understand-then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.
"And let him who is on the housetop not go down into the house, nor enter it to take anything out of his house.
"And let him who is in the field not turn back again to pick up his cloak.
"But woe to those who are pregnant and to those who nurse in those days.
"Pray that your escape not be in the winter.
"For in those days there will be affliction such as never was since creation-which God created-up to that time, nor never will be.
"Unless the Lord shortens those days, no flesh would be saved, but for the elect's sake, whom he has chosen, he has shortened those days.
"Then if any one will say to you, «Look! Here is Christ,» or «Look! He is there;» don't believe him.
"For false Christs and false prophets will rise and show signs and wonders to lead astray, if possible, even the elect.
"Now you be aware. Look, I have foretold you all things.
"And in those days, after that tribulation, the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give her light.
"And the stars of heaven will fall, and the powers that are in heaven will be shaken.
"Then they will see the Son of Man coming in the clouds with great power and glory.
"Then he will send his angels and will gather his elect together from the four winds from the farthest most part of earth to the farthest part of heaven.
"Now learn the parable of the fig tree. When her branch in still tender and puts out leaves, you know that summer in near.
"In the same way when you see these things happening, know that it is very close, even at the door.
"Truly I say to you: that generation will not die until all these things are finished.
"Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.
"But concerning that day and hour, no one knows, no, not even the angels who are in heaven, nor the Son, only the Father.
"Beware, be watchful and pray, for you do not know when that time is.
"[For the Son of Man is] like a man taking a far journey, who left his home and delegated authority to his servants, to every man his work, and commanded the porter to watch.
"Watch therefore, for you do not know when the master of the house comes, at evening, at midnight, at the rooster's crowing, or in the morning.
"Lest coming suddenly he find you sleeping.
"And what I say to you, I say to all: Watch."
